meanings.definition: A unit of length equal to one thousandth of a meter.
meanings.sent1: The ruler showed the length in millimetres.
meanings.sent2: She measured the tiny bug with a millimetre ruler.
meanings.sent3: The millimetre was so small, it got lost among the other units.
meanings.sent4: In the land of tiny creatures, a millimetre was as long as a mile.
meanings.sent5: The millimetre was like a miniature bridge connecting two worlds.

meanings.sent1: The scientist examined the millimetre-sized grain under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: The millimetre of rain made the ground wet.
meanings.sent3: The millimetre of chocolate on the cake made it irresistible.
meanings.sent4: In the vast desert, a millimetre of water was a precious treasure.
meanings.sent5: The millimetre of dust on the shelf showed it hadn't been cleaned in ages.
